title: Controlling Matplotlib Tick Labels with Unicode
description: In this lab, we will learn how to control the tick labels in a Matplotlib plot using Unicode minus and ASCII hyphen. By default, tick labels at negative values are rendered using a Unicode minus rather than an ASCII hyphen. However, this can be controlled by setting axes.unicode_minus. We will use a sample code snippet to showcase the difference between the two glyphs in a magnified font.
